effects

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • effects.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    All classes that are drawn to the screen use an Animation. This class loops through the different frames that is passed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animation()
      Creates a new Animation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
      Returns the current frame in this animation

      Returns whether or not this animation has played through once or not

      Sets a delay between each frame
      void setFrames(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames)
      Sets the frames that a given animation will use
      void update()
      Updates the animation

    • Method Detail

      • setFrames

        public void setFrames(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames)
        Sets the frames that a given animation will use
        Parameters:
        frames - The set of frames that the animation will loop through

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay(long delay)
        Sets a delay between each frame
        Parameters:
        delay - The time to wait, before going to the next frame

        Updates the animation

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns the current frame in this animation
        Returns:
        the current frame in this animation

      • hasPlayedOnce

        public boolean hasPlayedOnce()
        Returns whether or not this animation has played through once or not
        Returns:
        true if this animation has played once fully, and false otherwise
